qas.question: What principal contribution did von Neumann make to atomic bomb?

answers.text: concept and design of the explosive lenses needed to compress the plutonium core

qas.question: Did von Nemann think that the atomic bomb design was not workable?

answers.text: he was one of its most persistent proponents, encouraging its continued development

qas.question: What additional ideas did von Neumann contribute to Atomic bomb?

answers.text: more powerful shaped charges and less fissionable material to greatly increase the speed of "assembly"

context: Von Neumann's principal contribution to the atomic bomb was in the <a0_0>concept and design of the explosive lenses needed to compress the plutonium core<a0_0/> of the Fat Man weapon that was later dropped on Nagasaki. While von Neumann did not originate the "implosion" concept, <a1_0>he was one of its most persistent proponents, encouraging its continued development<a1_0/> against the instincts of many of his colleagues, who felt such a design to be unworkable. He also eventually came up with the idea of using <a2_0>more powerful shaped charges and less fissionable material to greatly increase the speed of "assembly"<a2_0/>.
